action.action-desc: Ms. Gabbard introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: To amend the Intelligence Reform and Terrorism Prevention Act of 2004 to enhance security clearance investigation procedures, and for other purposes.

section.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Security Clearance Enhancement Act of 2014
.

section.header: Enhancement of security clearance investigation procedures

subsection.text: Section 3001(c)(2) of the Intelligence Reform and Terrorism Prevention Act of 2004 (50 U.S.C. 3341(c)(2)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (B) by striking and at the end;
in subparagraph (C) by striking the period and inserting a semicolon; and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: ensure that each personnel security investigation of an individual collects data relevant to the granting, denial, or revocation of the access to classified information, including—

clause.text: information relating to a criminal or civil legal proceeding to which the individual is or becomes a party or witness;
financial information, including information relating to—

subclause.text: high-value assets, including financial assets, obtained by the individual from an unknown source; and
bank accounts and bank account balances;

clause.text: public information, including news articles or reports, that includes derogatory information about the individual;
information posted on a social media website or forum that may suggest ill intent, vulnerability to blackmail, compulsive behavior, allegiance to another country, or change in ideology; and
data maintained on a terrorist or criminal watch list maintained by an agency, State or local government, or international organization, including any such list maintained by—

subclause.text: the Office of Foreign Assets Control of the Department of the Treasury;
the Federal Bureau of Investigation; and

subparagraph.text: provide for review of the accuracy and comprehensiveness of information relating to the access to classified information of an individual through timely periodic reinvestigations and include data collected during such reinvestigations in the database required by subsection (e); and

provide for a process for notification of an agency employing or contracting with personnel with access to classified information if a verification or periodic reinvestigation has revealed information pertinent to revocation of the access.

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1) by striking through 2011; and

subparagraph.text: by redesignating subparagraphs (B) and (C) as subparagraphs (C) and (D), respectively; and
by inserting after subparagraph (A) the following:
an assessment of the effectiveness of the database required by subsection (e);

subsection.header: Funding from the revolving fund of the Office of Personnel Management
subsection.text: Section 1304(e)(1) of title 5, United States Code, is amended by inserting the security clearance system required under section 3001(e) of the Intelligence Reform and Terrorism Prevention Act of 2004 (50 U.S.C. 3341(e)), after including.

section.text: None of the amendments made by this Act shall be construed as requiring increased consideration of information relating to minor financial or mental health issues of an individual in evaluating the access to classified information of such individual.
The amendments made by this Act shall take effect 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act.
